texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1. Programming & Data Wrangling
texts.text: 1. Programming & Data Wrangling

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill
texts.text: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Programming & data wrangling is the end-to-end craft of turning raw, messy, multi-source data into clean, welltyped, documented, and reproducible datasets that are ready for analysis or modeling. It spans acquiring data (files/APIs/DBs), validating schema and quality, parsing and transforming structures, handling missing/outlier values, joining disparate tables, reshaping (wide ↔ long), and packaging outputs with lineage so others-and future you-can trust and reuse them.
texts.text: Programming & data wrangling is the end-to-end craft of turning raw, messy, multi-source data into clean, welltyped, documented, and reproducible datasets that are ready for analysis or modeling. It spans acquiring data (files/APIs/DBs), validating schema and quality, parsing and transforming structures, handling missing/outlier values, joining disparate tables, reshaping (wide ↔ long), and packaging outputs with lineage so others-and future you-can trust and reuse them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Acquire → validate → clean → transform → integrate → document → deliver.
texts.text: Acquire → validate → clean → transform → integrate → document → deliver.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Works across formats (CSV/JSON/Parquet), sources (SQL/NoSQL/APIs), and scales (pandas ↔ Spark/Dask).
texts.text: Works across formats (CSV/JSON/Parquet), sources (SQL/NoSQL/APIs), and scales (pandas ↔ Spark/Dask).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Emphasizes correctness, reproducibility, and performance as much as functionality.
texts.text: Emphasizes correctness, reproducibility, and performance as much as functionality.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Produces artifacts: tidy tables, feature matrices, data dictionaries, and reusable scripts/pipelines.
texts.text: Produces artifacts: tidy tables, feature matrices, data dictionaries, and reusable scripts/pipelines.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2) Intelligence Needed to Excel in This Skill
texts.text: 2) Intelligence Needed to Excel in This Skill

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Excelling requires a blend of algorithmic thinking, systems awareness, and ruthless attention to detail-because small data defects silently corrupt downstream insights.
texts.text: Excelling requires a blend of algorithmic thinking, systems awareness, and ruthless attention to detail-because small data defects silently corrupt downstream insights.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Algorithmic & decomposition thinking: break large messes into tractable steps (parse → type → dedupe → join → validate).
texts.text: Algorithmic & decomposition thinking: break large messes into tractable steps (parse → type → dedupe → join → validate).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Probabilistic/uncertainty awareness: reason about missingness mechanisms (MCAR/MAR/MNAR) and how imputations affect bias/variance.
texts.text: Probabilistic/uncertainty awareness: reason about missingness mechanisms (MCAR/MAR/MNAR) and how imputations affect bias/variance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Debugging mindset: hypothesize → instrument → test; isolate defects with minimal examples.
texts.text: Debugging mindset: hypothesize → instrument → test; isolate defects with minimal examples.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Pattern recognition: spot schema drift, mixed data types, unit inconsistencies, encoding issues.
texts.text: Pattern recognition: spot schema drift, mixed data types, unit inconsistencies, encoding issues.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Systems thinking: understand the data's lifecycle (upstream producers, downstream consumers, SLAs).
texts.text: Systems thinking: understand the data's lifecycle (upstream producers, downstream consumers, SLAs).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Optimization intuition: choose vectorized ops, push filters to the DB, minimize shuffles, sample smartly.
texts.text: Optimization intuition: choose vectorized ops, push filters to the DB, minimize shuffles, sample smartly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Communication clarity: write crisp docstrings, data dictionaries, and commit messages others can follow.
texts.text: Communication clarity: write crisp docstrings, data dictionaries, and commit messages others can follow.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3) Impact of This Skill for a Data Scientist
texts.text: 3) Impact of This Skill for a Data Scientist

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Strong wrangling multiplies your impact: models converge faster, dashboards don't break, and stakeholders trust the numbers-because inputs are reliable and pipelines are reproducible.
texts.text: Strong wrangling multiplies your impact: models converge faster, dashboards don't break, and stakeholders trust the numbers-because inputs are reliable and pipelines are reproducible.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Speed & iteration: cleaner inputs → fewer modeling detours; faster EDA and feature engineering.
texts.text: Speed & iteration: cleaner inputs → fewer modeling detours; faster EDA and feature engineering.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Model quality: well-typed, de-duplicated, correctly joined data reduces leakage and spurious correlations.
texts.text: Model quality: well-typed, de-duplicated, correctly joined data reduces leakage and spurious correlations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Reliability & trust: documented lineage + validation checks prevent 'why do numbers not match?' crises.
texts.text: Reliability & trust: documented lineage + validation checks prevent 'why do numbers not match?' crises.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Collaboration: standardized datasets/feature stores enable team reuse and consistent metrics.
texts.text: Collaboration: standardized datasets/feature stores enable team reuse and consistent metrics.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Scalability & cost: efficient queries and storage (partitioning, columnar formats) cut compute bills.
texts.text: Scalability & cost: efficient queries and storage (partitioning, columnar formats) cut compute bills.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Compliance & risk: PII handling, versioning, and audit trails reduce regulatory and reputational risk.
texts.text: Compliance & risk: PII handling, versioning, and audit trails reduce regulatory and reputational risk.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Signals/KPIs of impact
texts.text: Signals/KPIs of impact

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Fewer data-quality incidents; faster time-to-first-model; % pipelines with automated tests; SLA adherence; reduction in duplicate transformations; reproducible runs from clean checkout.
texts.text: Fewer data-quality incidents; faster time-to-first-model; % pipelines with automated tests; SLA adherence; reduction in duplicate transformations; reproducible runs from clean checkout.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2. Statistics & Math
texts.text: 2. Statistics & Math

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill
texts.text: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Statistics & math provide the language of uncertainty and the mechanics that make models work. Statistics turns noisy samples into defensible conclusions (estimation, testing, inference), while math-primarily linear algebra, calculus, and optimization-explains how learning algorithms represent data, fit parameters, and generalize.
texts.text: Statistics & math provide the language of uncertainty and the mechanics that make models work. Statistics turns noisy samples into defensible conclusions (estimation, testing, inference), while math-primarily linear algebra, calculus, and optimization-explains how learning algorithms represent data, fit parameters, and generalize.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Statistics (inferential): estimation, confidence/credible intervals, hypothesis testing, effect sizes, power.
texts.text: Statistics (inferential): estimation, confidence/credible intervals, hypothesis testing, effect sizes, power.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Probability: random variables, distributions, expectations, variance, conditional probability, Bayes' rule.
texts.text: Probability: random variables, distributions, expectations, variance, conditional probability, Bayes' rule.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Mathematical foundations: linear algebra (vectors, matrices, eigendecomposition), calculus (gradients), convexity/optimization.
texts.text: Mathematical foundations: linear algebra (vectors, matrices, eigendecomposition), calculus (gradients), convexity/optimization.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Applied areas: regression/GLMs, time series, experimental design (A/B/n, power), Bayesian methods, resampling (bootstrap), causal inference (DAGs, confounding).
texts.text: Applied areas: regression/GLMs, time series, experimental design (A/B/n, power), Bayesian methods, resampling (bootstrap), causal inference (DAGs, confounding).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Goal: quantify uncertainty, separate signal from noise, and choose models/assumptions appropriate to the data-generating process.
texts.text: Goal: quantify uncertainty, separate signal from noise, and choose models/assumptions appropriate to the data-generating process.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2) Intelligence Needed to Excel in This Skill
texts.text: 2) Intelligence Needed to Excel in This Skill

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Excelling requires comfort with abstraction plus a habit of testing assumptions against reality.
texts.text: Excelling requires comfort with abstraction plus a habit of testing assumptions against reality.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Abstraction & formal reasoning: translate real problems into variables, distributions, and constraints.

texts.text: Modeling judgment: choose priors/link functions/losses that match the data and stakes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Uncertainty intuition: reason with intervals, posteriors, and predictive distributions (not just point estimates).
texts.text: Uncertainty intuition: reason with intervals, posteriors, and predictive distributions (not just point estimates).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Diagnostic mindset: check residuals, stability, identifiability, collinearity, and misspecification.
texts.text: Diagnostic mindset: check residuals, stability, identifiability, collinearity, and misspecification.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Trade-off thinking: bias-variance, variance-cost, precision-recall, Type I vs Type II error.
texts.text: Trade-off thinking: bias-variance, variance-cost, precision-recall, Type I vs Type II error.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Causal skepticism: distinguish correlation vs causation; anticipate confounders and selection bias.
texts.text: Causal skepticism: distinguish correlation vs causation; anticipate confounders and selection bias.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Numerical sense: sanity-check magnitudes, units, and condition numbers; detect data leakage.
texts.text: Numerical sense: sanity-check magnitudes, units, and condition numbers; detect data leakage.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3. Machine Learning Fundamentals
texts.text: 3. Machine Learning Fundamentals

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill
texts.text: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Machine learning (ML) fundamentals are the core principles for turning data into predictive or descriptive models that generalize to unseen cases. At its heart, ML defines a representation of inputs (features), a target to learn (labels or structure), an objective (loss/score), an optimizer to fit parameters, and a validation scheme to estimate out-of-sample performance. Fundamentals also include choosing the right problem framing (supervised vs unsupervised vs reinforcement), preventing leakage/overfitting, and translating model outputs into decisions.
texts.text: Machine learning (ML) fundamentals are the core principles for turning data into predictive or descriptive models that generalize to unseen cases. At its heart, ML defines a representation of inputs (features), a target to learn (labels or structure), an objective (loss/score), an optimizer to fit parameters, and a validation scheme to estimate out-of-sample performance. Fundamentals also include choosing the right problem framing (supervised vs unsupervised vs reinforcement), preventing leakage/overfitting, and translating model outputs into decisions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · What ML covers:
texts.text: What ML covers:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Problem framings: supervised (regression/classification), unsupervised (clustering, density, dimensionality reduction), time series/sequence, recommendation, anomaly detection.
texts.text: o Problem framings: supervised (regression/classification), unsupervised (clustering, density, dimensionality reduction), time series/sequence, recommendation, anomaly detection.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Pipeline: define task → collect/label → split data → features → model → tune → validate → test → monitor.
texts.text: o Pipeline: define task → collect/label → split data → features → model → tune → validate → test → monitor.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Generalization: bias-variance trade-off, capacity/regularization, inductive biases.
texts.text: o Generalization: bias-variance trade-off, capacity/regularization, inductive biases.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Evaluation: appropriate metrics, uncertainty/calibration, business objectives/constraints.
texts.text: o Evaluation: appropriate metrics, uncertainty/calibration, business objectives/constraints.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Ethics & safety: fairness, privacy, robustness, and responsible deployment.
texts.text: o Ethics & safety: fairness, privacy, robustness, and responsible deployment.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2) Intelligence Needed to Excel in This Skill
texts.text: 2) Intelligence Needed to Excel in This Skill

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Success in ML requires structured problem-solving, statistical intuition, and rigorous experimentation. You must reason about uncertainty, isolate causes, and iterate rapidly without fooling yourself.
texts.text: Success in ML requires structured problem-solving, statistical intuition, and rigorous experimentation. You must reason about uncertainty, isolate causes, and iterate rapidly without fooling yourself.

texts.orig: Deep Learning & GenAI
texts.text: Deep Learning & GenAI

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill
texts.text: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Deep learning (DL) uses multi-layer neural networks to learn hierarchical representations from data, enabling state- of-the-art performance on images, text, audio, video, and multi-modal inputs. Generative AI (GenAI) focuses on models that produce content-text, images, code, audio-most notably large foundation models (e.g., Transformers) pre-trained on massive corpora and adapted via fine-tuning, prompting, or retrieval. Together, DL + GenAI span the lifecycle from representation learning to controllable generation, with modern practice emphasizing data/compute scaling , transfer learning , prompt/program design , and safe deployment .
texts.text: Deep learning (DL) uses multi-layer neural networks to learn hierarchical representations from data, enabling state- of-the-art performance on images, text, audio, video, and multi-modal inputs. Generative AI (GenAI) focuses on models that produce content-text, images, code, audio-most notably large foundation models (e.g., Transformers) pre-trained on massive corpora and adapted via fine-tuning, prompting, or retrieval. Together, DL + GenAI span the lifecycle from representation learning to controllable generation, with modern practice emphasizing data/compute scaling , transfer learning , prompt/program design , and safe deployment .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Neural networks learn features automatically (vs. manual feature engineering).
texts.text: Neural networks learn features automatically (vs. manual feature engineering).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Architectures: CNNs (vision), RNNs/Seq2Seq (legacy sequence), Transformers (current SOTA for text/vision/audio/multimodal).
texts.text: Architectures: CNNs (vision), RNNs/Seq2Seq (legacy sequence), Transformers (current SOTA for text/vision/audio/multimodal).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Foundation models: pre-trained on broad data; adapted by fine-tuning , parameter-efficient tuning (LoRA/adapters), RAG (retrieval-augmented generation), or prompting .
texts.text: Foundation models: pre-trained on broad data; adapted by fine-tuning , parameter-efficient tuning (LoRA/adapters), RAG (retrieval-augmented generation), or prompting .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Objectives: predictive (cross-entropy, MSE) and generative (language modeling, diffusion).
texts.text: Objectives: predictive (cross-entropy, MSE) and generative (language modeling, diffusion).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Emphasis on evaluation, safety, and guardrails due to open-ended generation.
texts.text: Emphasis on evaluation, safety, and guardrails due to open-ended generation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5. Data Engineering Basics
texts.text: 5. Data Engineering Basics

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill
texts.text: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Data engineering is the discipline of designing, building, and operating the systems that move, transform, store, and serve data-reliably, securely, and at scale. It turns scattered operational data (OLTP) into analytics-ready, governed datasets (OLAP) via pipelines and storage layers with clear lineage, quality checks, and SLAs . For a data scientist, it's the substrate that makes analysis and ML possible-and repeatable.
texts.text: Data engineering is the discipline of designing, building, and operating the systems that move, transform, store, and serve data-reliably, securely, and at scale. It turns scattered operational data (OLTP) into analytics-ready, governed datasets (OLAP) via pipelines and storage layers with clear lineage, quality checks, and SLAs . For a data scientist, it's the substrate that makes analysis and ML possible-and repeatable.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MLOps / Productionization
texts.text: MLOps / Productionization

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill
texts.text: 1) Background / Definition of the Skill

texts.label: text
texts.orig: MLOps is the discipline of taking models from notebooks to reliable, monitored, and cost-aware production services . It blends software engineering, data engineering, and DevOps to manage the full ML lifecycle : data/version control → training & tuning → packaging → CI/CD → deployment (batch/online) → monitoring (data, model, system) → governance & rollback. The goal is repeatability and safety : anyone on the team can reproduce a model, ship it behind clear contracts, observe it in the wild, and improve it without breaking downstream users.
texts.text: MLOps is the discipline of taking models from notebooks to reliable, monitored, and cost-aware production services . It blends software engineering, data engineering, and DevOps to manage the full ML lifecycle : data/version control → training & tuning → packaging → CI/CD → deployment (batch/online) → monitoring (data, model, system) → governance & rollback. The goal is repeatability and safety : anyone on the team can reproduce a model, ship it behind clear contracts, observe it in the wild, and improve it without breaking downstream users.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · End-to-end lifecycle: data → train → evaluate → register → deploy → monitor → iterate .
texts.text: End-to-end lifecycle: data → train → evaluate → register → deploy → monitor → iterate .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Treats models as artifacts with versions, metadata, and approvals.
texts.text: Treats models as artifacts with versions, metadata, and approvals.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Emphasizes automation (CI/CD), observability (metrics/logs/traces), and governance (review, audit).
texts.text: Emphasizes automation (CI/CD), observability (metrics/logs/traces), and governance (review, audit).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Supports multiple delivery patterns: batch scoring, real-time APIs, streaming, on-device.
texts.text: Supports multiple delivery patterns: batch scoring, real-time APIs, streaming, on-device.
